content:
• Friday, June 15, 2018
  • ADT

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (06/15/2018)

    • Top gainers: ADT +3.1%. TDW +2.6%. BSBR +1.8%. SOGO +1.8%. TUP +1.6%.
    • Top Losers: ELP -1.5%. LOMA -1.4%.  I -1.3%. ITUB -1.1%. BCH -1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 3 Comments
  • PVAC

    PVAC +3.7%, FLT +4.5% on index changes; NVDA to S&P 100

    • Penn Virginia (NASDAQ:PVAC) is up 3.7% after hours on the news it's heading into the S&P SmallCap 600.
    • It will make the move prior to next Friday's open; it's replacing Analogic (NASDAQ:ALOG), which is set to be acquired by Altaris Capital Partners around then.
    • Meanwhile, with AT&T's $85B deal for Time Warner complete and Time Warner (NYSE:TWX) delisting, Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) will replace Time Warner in the S&P 100, and FleetCor (NYSE:FLT) will replace Time Warner in the S&P 500. Those moves are effective prior to Wednesday's open.
    • FLT is up 4.5% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM | 12 Comments
  • ENT

    Global Eagle +6.6% as Northland adds more praise

    • Global Eagle Entertainment (NASDAQ:ENT) rose 6.6% after a new note from Northland highlights a turnaround in the "top of the 2nd inning."
    • The company's in the "early innings of a multi- year operational/financial comeback," analyst Paul Penney says. He has an Outperform rating with a $4.75 price target, implying a heavy 73% upside from today's closing price. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • A few weeks ago, Northland praised Global Eagle while noting its path departing from rival Gogo (NASDAQ:GOGO), which it says is dealing with "deep-rooted" problems. GOGO rose 1% today but is still down 54% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM | 20 Comments
  • GE

    GE hits lowest in two months as Fitch cuts rating

    • General Electric (GE -2.5%) shares slumped in today's trade to a two-month low after Fitch Ratings downgrades its rating a notch to A from A+ with a negative outlook.
    • Fitch expects GE's cash flow and earnings "will continue to be constrained while it addresses underperformance in the Power business, evaluates its business portfolio, and carries out extensive restructuring actions to reduce its cost structure."
    • Fitch also cites the trend in GE's portfolio actions, the company's large net pension obligations, a meaningful reliance on commercial paper and factored receivables that contribute to elevated leverage, and a weaker balance sheet at GE Capital which increases the risk that future support may be needed from GE.
    • Standard & Poor's also rates GE's credit at A, while Moody's rates it at A2.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 147 Comments
  • XOM

    Oil prices plunge ahead of next week's OPEC meeting; energy stocks whacked

    • Oil prices settled sharply lower, with Brent crude ending at a six-week low, as Saudi Arabia and Russia appear ready to raise production at next week's OPEC meeting in Vienna.
    • August Brent settled -3.3% to $73.44/bbl, the lowest settlement since May 2 and capping a ~4% loss for the week, while July WTI finished -2.7% at $65.06/bbl, its lowest finish since June 6 as it lost 1% for the week.
    • Saudi Arabia is considering a production hike of 500K-1M bbl/day while Russia is looking at an increase of as much as 1.5M bbl/day, although the “vast majority” of OPEC producers are arguing against relaxing production curbs that have been in place for 18 months, says Helima Croft, head of commodity strategy at RBC Capital.
    • As a result, Croft thinks Saudi Arabia and the OPEC leadership likely will deliver a modest 500K bbl/day rise while signaling readiness to quickly fill serious supply gaps if needed; however, next week's meeting could prove so contentious that Saudi Arabia and Russia are left to act on their own.
    • In the stock market, energy companies are taking a beating: XOM -1.4%, CVX -2%, CHK -2.2%, BP -2.8%, EOG -2.9%, APA -3%, RDS.A -3.1%, DVN -3.6%, APC -3.7%, PXD -3.8%, COP -4.2%, CLR -5.5%, MRO -5.6%, NBR -8%, WLL -9.5%.
    • ETFs: USO, XLE, OIL, UWT, UCO, VDE, XOP, DWT, ERX, OIH, SCO, BNO, DBO, ERY, DIG, BGR, GUSH, DTO, FENY, USL, IYE, DUG, DRIP, IEO, FIF, DNO, NDP, PXE, OLO, RYE, PXJ, SZO, CRAK, FXN, OLEM, WTIU, DDG, OILK, NANR, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, FTXN, JHME, UBRT, ERYY, DBRT, ERGF, OILD, OILU, USAI
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 229 Comments
  • BMI

    Badger Meter +2.5% following Canaccord upgrade

    • Badger Meter (BMI +2.5%) moves higher after Canaccord Genuity upgrades shares to Hold from Sell with a $44 price target, raised from $40, saying BMI will continue to benefit from favorable demand for water/flow measurement and conservation technologies in the future.
    • While the firm likes BMI's technology and overall market positioning, it says the stock's valuation is at the higher end of historical ranges and well above peers.
    • Canaccord believes price increases will help offset the impact of rising commodity costs, and sees a more favorable domestic municipal market as well as continued momentum for oil, gas and industrial applications.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZEN

    Zendesk competitor gets $26M in funding

    • Zendesk (NYSE:ZEN) competitor Kustomer has raised $26M in Series B funding led by early Zendesk investor Redpoint Ventures. Canaan Partners, Boldstart Ventures, and Social Leverage also participated.
    • Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) Investments joined as a strategic investor.
    • The round brought Kustomer’s total funding to $38.5M.    
    • Zendesk shares are down 1% to $58.81.    
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • CLPS

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (06/15/2018)

    • Gainers: CLPS +55%. OTCPK:LFIN +26%. OSS +11%. NETE +11%. ZUO +10%.
    • Losers: VVPR -10%. DQ -10%. GRVY -9%. IFON -9%. RFIL -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • RIG

    Transocean to retire four rigs, take related $520M Q2 charge

    • Transocean (RIG -2.4%) is lower after disclosing plans to retire four of its older rigs and take a related $520M charge during Q2.
    • RIG says it continues to evaluate the long-term competitiveness of its fleet and may identify additional rigs as candidates for retirement.
    • Bernstein analyst Colin Davies reiterates a Market Weight rating on RIG, saying the company scrapped the rigs because they were not competitive in today's market as "older rigs built before this decade's massive new build cycle are squeezed out and eventual scrappage is inevitable."
    • Many rig contractors have aging rigs on their books, including many "ancient floaters built before 1998 with less book value exposure" as well as those built during 1999-2005 that are old "but still have much book value remaining," Davies says.
    • Along with RIG, Davies says Ensco (ESV -5.4%) and Seadrill (SDRL -4.5%) have the highest ownership of rigs at risk of scrapping but still with significant remaining book value.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 42 Comments
  • GM

    GM jumps on report of Cruise listing

    • General Motors (GM +1.5%) surges after Bloomberg reports that the company is considering listing shares of the Cruise Automation self-driving unit.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM | 4 Comments
  • BA

    Boeing assessing possible impact of tariffs on its products

    • Boeing (BA -1.6%) and Caterpillar (CAT -2.1%), among the companies potentially harmed the most by a U.S.-China tit-for-tat tariff fight, are today's two biggest decliners on the Dow Jones 30 index.
    • Boeing says it is assessing the possible impacts of tariffs on its supply chain and commercial business.
    • Separately, Boeing's head of commercial sales Ihssane Mounir says engine problems at Rolls-Royce have “rattled” the aviation industry but have not slowed sales of the 787 Dreamliner.
    • “I haven’t seen any slowdown in sales right now," Mounir tells Reuters. "These are growing and teething pains for any product.”
    • Also, the Pentagon yesterday awarded Boeing a $1.5B contract for upgrades of F/A-18A/B, C/D, E/F and EA-18G aircraft for the Navy and foreign military sales customers.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 17 Comments
  • IBM

    STAT: IBM's Watson Health scaling back hospital contracts business

    • IBM (NYSE:IBM) Watson Health execs told employees this week that the division will scale back its business selling tools to help hospital manage contracts, according to STAT sources.
    • Watson Health had invested billions into winning contracts from hospitals that wanted to switch their payment systems to a patient outcome focus rather than volume of care. 
    • IBM shares are down 0.4% to $144.63.  
    • Previously: IBM acquires MRO inventory software company (June 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM | 16 Comments
  • LULU

    Retail stocks hitting their 52-week high

    • A number of retail stocks are having solid days to push to new 52-week highs. The list of gainers includes Lululemon (LULU +2.2%), The Container Store (TCS +6.8%), Canada Goose (GOOS +28.1%), Costco (COST +0.9%), Wayfair (W +2.6%), Domino's Pizza (DPZ +0.9%) and Texas Roadhouse (TXRH +1.8%).
    • The group of consumer-facing companies is the for the most part shielded from some of the tariff anxiety hitting the broad market.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • BAK

    Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (06/15/2018)

    • Gainers: BAK +20%. SCHN +7%.
    • Losers: MXC -14%. EGY -12%. ENSV -12%. NBR -8%. SN -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • ALDR

    Teva's pain is Alder's gain in migraine; shares up 15%

    • Alder Biopharma (ALDR +14.8%) is up on almost 40% higher volume as investors believe that Teva's exit from developing CGRP inhibitor fremenezumab for chronic cluster headache is a positive for Alder's CGRP inhibitor eptinezumab, in Phase 3 development for chronic and episodic migraine.
    • Previously: Teva bails on fremanezumab for chronic cluster headache in late-stage study; shares down 2% premarket (June 15)
    • Previously: Alder's eptinezumab shows treatment benefit in late-stage migraine study (April 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM | 4 Comments
  • TCI

    • Losers: HCC -10%. CIFS -7%. NAVI -7%. CRF -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • CLPS

    Midday Gainers / Losers (06/15/2018)

    • Gainers: CLPS +34%. GOOS +27%. NDRA +24%. BAK +19%. TPIV +19%. VSTM +16%. CFRX +15%. NETE +14%. TCI +14%. NEWA +13%.
    • Losers: ACHV -30%. CUR -19%. AFMD -17%. NFEC -17%. GBT -13%. CLWT -12%. CYTX -11%. HCC -11%. VVPR -11%. NVIV -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • IBM

    IBM acquires MRO inventory software company

    • IBM (NYSE:IBM) acquires Oniqua Holdings for undisclosed terms.
    • Oniqua Holdings makes Maintenance Repair and Operations (MRO) inventory optimization software for industrial use. IBM is acquiring the team and the tech. 
    • IBM says the acquisition expands its Asset Optimization Practice in helping clients streamline inventories and predict when parts and equipment might fail to avoid downtime. 
    • IBM shares are down 0.5% to $144.47.       
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 13 Comments
  • I

    Intelsat demonstrating 8K video for World Cup

    • Intelsat (I +3.9%) is partnering with Latin American broadcaster Globo to demonstrate live 8K video transmissions for this year's World Cup.
    • Starting today and running through July 15, the company will use Intelsat 14 (the newest emerging HD video neighborhood in Latin America) to display matches in 7680 x 4320 pixels at Rio de Janeiro’s Museu de Amanhã.
    • That will require transmitting a 200 Mbps video stream from Moscow to Tokyo and then carrying it to Intelsat via a New York point of presence, then via terrestrial network to its Atlanta teleport for re-encoding and compression.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • VNCE

    Vince Holding up 7% post Q1 results

    • Vince Holding (VNCE +7.6%) reported Q1 net sales of $54.5M (-6.1% Y/Y). Segment sales: Wholesale $28.5M (-19.5% Y/Y), sales decreased due to planned reduction in full-price wholesale partners, and Direct-to-customers $26M (+14.9% Y/Y).
    • Comparable sales grew by 12.3% due to an increase in transactions.
    • Q1 Overall margins: Gross improved by 275 bps to 46.8% and operating recovered by 611 bps to -8%.
    • SG&A expenses decreased by 11.5% Y/Y to $29.9M, reflecting lower product development cost and the non-recurrence of investments made last year.
    • Net inventory was at $49.4M (+55% Y/Y) the increase is due to change in the timing of shipments to the off-price wholesale channel, growth of the replenishment program, and the reinstatement of summer collection.
    • Cash and cash equivalents of $5.2M and $50.6M in borrowings under debt agreements.
    • FY18 Outlook: Net sales $273-280M and operating income $3-6M.
    • Previously: Vince reports Q1 results (June 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • AVLR

    Avalara starts first day of trade up 46%

    • Avalara (NYSE:AVLR) shares opened the first day of trading up nearly 46% from the $24 pricing.
    • The company sells automated tax compliance software for businesses and includes integrations with Oracle, Workday, and Stripe.
    • Competitors: CCH Incorporated (OTC:WOLTF, OTCPK:WTKWY), ONESOURCE Indirect Tax (NYSE:TRI), Sovos and Vertex.  
    • Other cloud-related companies getting a boost: Zuora (ZUO +5.7%), Dropbox (DBX +7.6%), Carbon Black (CBLK +4.3%), MongoDB (MDB +0.9%). 
    • Previously: Avalara preps for IPO (June 13)
    • Previously: Avalara prices IPO above range, at $24/share (June 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • CISN

    Cision prices secondary offering; shares -3.2%

    • Cision (CISN -3.3%) today announced the pricing of an underwritten public offering of 12M ordinary shares by certain selling shareholders at a public offering price of $15.00/share.
    • Cision is not selling any ordinary shares in the offering and will not receive any proceeds from the offering by the selling shareholders.
    • The offering is expected to close on June 19, 2018, subject to customary closing conditions.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • VALE

    Samarco reportedly near settlement with Brazil prosecutors

    • Joint venture partners Vale (VALE -3.7%) and BHP Billiton (BHP -3.9%) are close to signing a definitive settlement with Brazilian prosecutors that will clear the way to restart Samarco iron ore operations and debt talks to begin, Bloomberg reports.
    • The partners have secured four court extensions to negotiate the settlement of a multibillion-dollar claim stemming from the fatal 2015 tailings dam disaster, but this time the group is on track to meet the deadline, which now stands at June 25, according to the report.
    • A settlement reportedly would allow talks with creditors to begin as Samarco starts to draft its long-term business plan, although any restructuring deal would require a firm restart date; Vale’s best case is a limited restart in H1 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM | 3 Comments
  • LEE

    Lee Enterprises CFO Mayo resigns

    • Ronald Mayo is resigning his posts as VP, chief financial officer and treasurer of Lee Enterprises (LEE +2.9%).
    • He'll return to Denver for family considerations after dealing with a medical issue; he's been on leave since April.
    • “Since joining Lee in 2015, I have been commuting between Davenport and Denver," Lee says. "While I am fully recovered from my medical issue, the recent events made me realize the importance of living and working in the same city as my family."
    • Tim Millage will serve as acting principal financial and accounting officer.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM | 4 Comments
  • GOOS

    Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM (06/15/2018)

    • Gainers: GOOS +28%. VNCE +6%. WKHS +6%. PETZ +6%. FIZZ +5%.
    • Losers: ROX -6%. AOI -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • CHKE

    Cherokee down 8% post Q1 results

    • Cherokee (CHKE -8%) reports Q1 revenue decrease of 20.8% Y/Y to $5.4M.
    • S, G&A expenses were $4.4M (-26.7% Y/Y), the Y/Y decrease is due to reduced spending for personnel along with lower professional fees and other operating expenses following the completion of the Hi-Tec consolidation.
    • Adj. EBITDA margin increased 528 bps to 18.5%, this improvement was due to the decrease in S, G&A expenses.
    • Operating loss of $0.2M (-91.3% Y/Y) & net loss of $2.7M (-18.2% Y/Y).
    • Cash & equivalents of $2.5M and $49.1M of borrowings outstanding under its credit agreement.
    • The Company continues to face liquidity challenges with recurring operating losses and negative cash flows, it plans to address the Company’s ability to continue as a going concern through further negotiations with its lender and with other potential sources of capital.
    • 2019 Outlook: Revenues of $25-27M; Adj. EBITDA of $8-10M; SG&A of ~$17M, a reduction of $8.4M Y/Y.
    • Previously: Cherokee misses by $0.11, beats on revenue (June 14)
    ·          
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • NAV

    Navistar +5% as investors bet on Volkswagen bid

    • Navistar (NYSE:NAV) is up 5.45% as investors seize on the the new hiring at Volkswagen Truck & Bus as a sign that a full takeover of the company could be on the way. Jefferies has gone as far today as to say a deal is "likely."
    • Volkswagen Truck & Bus, which is prepping for a potential IPO, already has 17% of Navistar's shares in its back pocket.
    • Previously: Navistar on watch as Volkswagen lurks (June 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 3 Comments
  • XLRN

    Acceleron's luspatercept continues to show positive effects in mid-stage beta-thalassemia studies

    • Updated results from two Phase 2 clinical trials evaluating Acceleron Pharma's (XLRN -1.3%)  luspatercept in β-thalassemia patients showed a treatment benefit. The data were presented at the EHA Annual Meeting in Stockholm.
    • 41% (n=13) of 32 transfusion-dependent patients treated with luspatercept experienced a reduction in red blood cell transfusion burden of at least 33% from baseline.
    • 53% (n=16/30) on non-transfusion-dependent patients experienced at least a 1 gram/dL increase in hemoglobin from baseline.
    • Shares have been unable buck the market's selloff. A contributing factor may be bluebird bio's mid-stage data on gene therapy LentiGlobin in transfusion-dependent β-thalassemia. Seven of eight treated patients maintained hemoglobin levels just below the normal range and have remained transfusion-free for as long as 15 months (follow-up is continuing).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • MPO

    Midstates corrects SandRidge statement it says was inaccurate

    • Midstates Petroleum (MPO -3.5%) says a statement issued earlier today by SandRidge Energy (SD +1.3%) contained inaccuracies; shares are halted.
    • "While SandRidge has offered a non-disclosure agreement to Midstates, it would require Midstates to enter into a standstill, which is an unusual requirement for a party that has made a public offer," MPO says.
    • Also, MPO says SD said it would "not provide Midstates with internal forecasts that it is providing other process participants even if Midstates were to sign the NDA offered by SandRidge."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • BG

    Bunge to delay IPO of Brazilian sugar milling unit

    • Bunge (BG -2.4%) says it is delaying plans for an IPO of its Brazilian sugar milling business, citing current market conditions.
    • The price of sugar recently hit a three-year low, weighed down by a bumper Indian harvest, and fell another 1.7% in Chicago at $0.1235/lb. amid a broad drop in commodity prices after China said it would impose retaliatory tariffs following the new U.S. tariffs on $50B of Chinese imports.
    • Bunge had filed a preliminary prospectus for the sugar business with Brazilian regulators last month.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix to push interactive content

    • A Netflix (NFLX +0.7%) representative clarifies to TheNextWeb if Minecraft: Story Mode and other titles on the streaming service are games or content.
    • “We don’t have any plans to get into gaming. There’s a broad spectrum of entertainment available today. Games have become increasingly cinematic, but we view this as interactive narrative storytelling on our service," argues the rep.
    • The gaming entry denial could be considered a question of semantics, with users making choices for characters with a controller. It also opens up a whole new category of using existing content and franchises to generate user interest with the "interactive narrative storytelling" options.
    • Shares of GameStop (NYSE:GME) are up 0.93% after falling back yesterday.
    • Previously: Netflix clarifies gaming plans (June 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 9 Comments
  • T

    John Malone isn't rushing into media-merger fray

    • This week's ramp-up in the move toward media content/distribution juggernauts (via AT&T's closed deal for Time Warner) isn't yet tempting a titan of the cable industry: John Malone.
    • Though he owns sizable stakes in Charter (CHTR -0.2%) and Discovery (DISCA +3.5%), and despite his reputation as a dealmaking guru, Malone isn't rushing to put them together to keep up with AT&T (NYSE:T) and Comcast (CMCSA +0.4%).
    • “Why would I put Discovery together with Charter? Apples and oranges,” Malone tells Shalini Ramachandran. “If you are just forming a conglomerate by putting everything in the same bucket, it eliminates your flexibility, you’ve got tax problems, regulatory problems and a lot of problems that these companies operating autonomously don’t have.”
    • Charter may pursue smaller content opportunities, like regional sports nets or regional news, or teaming up with distributors in a joint venture to own content.
    • While he believes both Comcast and AT&T face a challenge pulling financial benefits out of their deals, he says AT&T may have an easier time with its national footprint (vs. the more regional footprints of Comcast and Charter).
    • Malone has seen regional benefits from a pursuit of Univision (UVN), which has spurned his advances, and he says other smaller content companies are ripe for plucking: Viacom (VIA +1.6%, VIAB +1.6%), CBS (CBS +1.7%), AMC Networks (AMCX +0.4%) and Lions Gate (LGF.A +3.8%, LGF.B +2.4%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 35 Comments
  • KPTI

    Karyopharm's selinexor shows positive effect in multiple myeloma study; shares up 2%

    • Updated results from a Phase 1b/2 clinical trial, STOMP, evaluating Karyopharm Therapeutics' (KPTI +2.2%) lead drug selinexor + dexamethasone, combined with Velcade (bortezomib), Pomalyst (pomalidomide) or Darzalex (daratumumab), in previously treated patients with multiple myeloma (MM) showed a treatment benefit. The data are being presented at the EHA Annual Meeting in Stockholm.
    • The objective response rate (ORR) in the selinexor/dex/bort cohort was 63%.
    • The ORR in the selinexor/dex/dara group was 68%.
    • The ORR in the selinexor/dex/pom group was 50%.
    • Selinexor has Orphan Drug and Fast Track status in the U.S. for this patient population.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM | 2 Comments
  • RYCEF

    Rolls-Royce sees free cash flow topping £1B guidance in 2020

    • Rolls-Royce (OTCPK:RYCEF, OTCPK:RYCEY) shoots higher after pledging to boost cash flow even as it grapples with the rising costs of fixing its Trent 1000 engines that power Boeing 787 Dreamliners.
    • Shares rose as much as 8% in U.K. trading after Rolls said it would exceed its 2020 guidance for free cash flow of £1B, possibly reaching £1.2B ($1.6B).
    • “The company’s new mid-term ambition of more than £1/share in free cash flow implies more than £1.8B in total free cash flow. This is well ahead of 2020 company compiled consensus,” according to Goldman Sachs analysts.
    • Rolls says belt tightening will allow it to maintain FY 2018 guidance of £350M-£550M million in free cash flow before restructuring costs.
    • The company said yesterday that it would incur £500M in restructuring costs through 2020 associated with 4,600 job cuts.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 2 Comments
  • MRKR

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (06/15/2018)

    • Gainers: TPIV +17%. NDRA +13%. SLNO +12%. VSTM +12%. ALDR +11%.
    • Losers: ACHV -30%. CUR -18%. AFMD -17%. GBT -12%. NVIV -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 13 Comments
  • FFHL

    Fuwei Films up 2.9% posts Q1 results

    • Fuwei Films (FFHL +2.9%) reports Q1 revenue growth of 13.2% Y/Y to RMB 76.9M.
    • Segment revenue: Stamping and transfer film RMB 30.9M (+14% Y/Y); Printing film RMB 5.9M (-6.3% Y/Y); Metalization film RMB 1.2M (-53.8% Y/Y); Specialty film RMB 33M (+51.4% Y/Y); Base film for other application RMB 6.1M (-40.2% Y/Y).
    • Specialty film sales accounted for 42.8% of total revenues, the increase was mainly due to increases in sales volume.
    • Gross margin increased 680 bps to 12.3%.
    • Average cost of goods sold increased by 5.1% Y/Y due to the price increase of main raw materials.
    • Average product sales prices increased by 13.0% Y/Y, the increase was significantly higher than that in the average cost of goods sold in Q1, which contributed to the increase in gross margin.
    • Operating expenses were RMB15.8M (+8% Y/Y), increase was mainly due to the increased allowance for doubtful accounts receivable and increased expense in R&D.
    • Previously: Fuwei Films reports Q1 results (June 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • CUR

    Neuralstem chief to bid adieu; shares down 14%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Neuralstem (CUR -13.5%) discloses that CEO, CFO & President Richard Daley intends to resign after a transitional period. A search for a successor is underway.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM | 3 Comments
  • HNGR

    More on Hanger's Q1 results

    • Hanger (HNGR +0.1%) reported Q1 revenue of $234M (+0.1% Y/Y), reflecting that Q1 results are generally affected by seasonality, making it the lowest revenue quarter for the year.
    • Patient care segment: Revenue $188.71M (+0.46% Y/Y), same clinic revenue per day grew 1.1% and prosthetics revenue grew by 6% Y/Y. Operating margin improved by 132 bps to 9.1% and Adj. EBITDA margin improved by 111 bps to 12.2%.
    • Product & services segment: Revenue $45.49M (-1.2% Y/Y) due to $1.3M decrease in revenue for therapeutic solution. Operating margin declined by 26 bps to 12.9% and Adj. EBITDA margin declined by 51 bps to 19%.
    • Q1 Overall margins: Operating improved by 435 bps to 0.27% and Adj. EBITDA improved by 80 bps to 6.94%.
    • Hanger intends to commence the process of relisting on a national securities exchange during 3Q18. The company plans not to host a conference call regarding first 1Q18 results.
    • FY18 outlook: Net revenue and Adj. EBITDA to be consistent with 2017.
    • Previously: Hanger reports Q1 results (June 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • ATRA

    Atara Bio's tab-cell shows durable effect in mid-stage studies in EBV-associated post-transplant lymphomas; shares up 1%

    • Long-term results from two Phase 2 clinical trials evaluating Atara Biotherapeutics' (ATRA +0.9%) off-the-shelf T-cell immunotherapy tabelecleucel (tab-cel) in patients with Epstein-Barr virus (EBV)-associated post-transplant lymphoproliferative disorder (EBV+PTLD) showed sustained benefits. The data were presented at the EHA Congress in Stockholm.
    • The studies assessed tab-cell in EBV+PTLD patients following hematopoietic cell transplant (HCT) or solid organ transplant (SOT) who failed first-line treatment with Roche's Rituxan (rituximab).
    • One- and three-year overall survival (OS) rates were 68% and 55%, respectively, in EBV+PTLD patients following HCT. Median OS was not reached after 23.3 months of follow-up, significantly greater than the expected 16 - 56 days for this patient population.
    • In EB+PTLD patients following SOT, one- and three-year OS rates were 64% and 43%, respectively. Median survival was 21.3 months, also superior to the expected survival of a median of 12-13 months.
    • Overall response rates in the two groups of patients were 69% and 50%, respectively.
    • Two Phase 3 trials are in process.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 2 Comments

  • BLUE

    Bluebird's LentiGlobin shows significant treatment benefit in beta-thalassemia patients; shares up 1% premarket

    • Bluebird bio (NASDAQ:BLUE) is up 1% premarket on light volume on the heels of its announcement of results from two clinical trials evaluating gene therapy LentiGlobin in patients with transfusion-dependent β-thalassemia (TDT), an inherited blood disorder characterized by reduced production of hemoglobin. The data were presented the European Hematology Association Congress in Stockholm.
    • Results from the completed Phase 1/2 Northstar study showed eight of 10 patients with non-β0/β0 genotypes were transfusion independent for a median of 33 months as of the last follow-up visit.
    • Preliminary data from the ongoing Phase 3 Northstar-2 study showed seven of eight patients were maintaining hemoglobin levels of 11.1 - 13.3 g/dL at month 6 (normal range is 13.5 - 17.5 g/dL for men and 12.0 - 15.5 g/dL for women). All seven remained transfusion-free for 4.7 - 15.1 months.
    • Previously: Dosing underway in bluebird's late-stage study of LentiGlobin in beta thalassemia (Dec. 14, 2016)

  • GBT

    GBT's voxelotor shows lower treatment effect in adolescents with SCD in mid-stage study; shares slip 4% premarket

    • Global Blood Therapeutics (NASDAQ:GBT) announces data from patients treated with the 900 mg dose of voxelotor in the ongoing HOPE-KIDS 1 Study, a Phase 2a open-label study in adolescents with sickle cell disease (SCD) at the European Hematology Association (EHA) Congress in Stockholm.
    • The EHA presentation analyzed 22 patients who received voxelotor 900 mg/day for 24 weeks in Part B. Data showed the following results achieved with voxelotor treatment:
    • Results demonstrated sustained and durable improvements in hemoglobin levels and a reduction in clinical measures of hemolysis with voxelotor.
    • 43% (55% rate reported in December 2017) of patients achieved a hemoglobin response >1 g/dL at 24 weeks with a median hemoglobin change from baseline of 0.7 g/dL.
    • Total symptom scores improved in 13 of 21 patients.
    • 55% of patients had a numerical decrease in transcranial doppler (TCD) flow; among hemoglobin responders (>1 g/dL), 88% had a numerical decrease in TCD at 24 weeks.
    • Voxelotor (GBT440) is being developed as an oral, once-daily therapy for patients with SCD. Voxelotor works by increasing hemoglobin's affinity for oxygen.
    • Shares are down 4% premarket.
    • Previously: Global Blood's voxelotor shows positive action in mid-stage study in adolescents with sickle cell disease, two deaths in compassionate use study pressures shares, down 10% (Dec. 11, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 AM | 39 Comments
